intro: Amygdalus communis var. maxima, commonly known as the Persian almond. This variety is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and the Middle East. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree that can grow up to 5 meters in height. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers in the spring, followed by edible nuts that are typically harvested in the autumn. Its hardy nature makes it well-suited for cultivation in temperate climates.
